item.title: esvis: Part 1
item.author: daniela@uoregon.edu (Daniel Anderson)
item.description: This is the first of a series of posts to introduce my new esvis R package, why I think it’s important, and some of its capabilities. As of this writing the current version on CRAN is 0.0.1, so it’s obviously still fresh and may have some bugs. If you find any, please let me know. You can install the package like you would any other on R install.packages("esvis") or if you’d prefer the sometimes bugging but more feature-heavy development version, install from github with devtools.

item.title: About me
item.author: daniela@uoregon.edu (Daniel Anderson)
item.description: I work as a research associate for Behavioral Research and Teaching, a grant-based center in the College of Education at the University of Oregon. My career in research began in measurement and psychometrics and I still do consulting work in that area. However, my research focus has mostly moved towards data science and the economics of education.
